objectives.en: The main aim of the course is to expand students' general academic and subject-specific vocabulary through a wide variety of activities:
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on arendada üldakadeemilist ja erialast sõnavara mitmesuguste tegevuste kaudu:
erialaste tekstide lugemine, kuulamine ja analüüsimine,

objectives.en: doing different vocabulary and listening tasks,

learning_outcomes.en: On completion of the course, the learners
have expanded their general academic and subject-specific vocabulary,
learning_outcomes.et: on laiendanud oma üldakadeemilist ja erialast sõnavara,

learning_outcomes.en: are able to better understand subject-specific texts,
are able to make academic presentations.

independent_work.et:
INDIVIDUAL ANSWERING (via Zoom)
1 Choose a research article (10 pages of text) on a subject-specific topic. 
https://utlib.ut.ee/andmebaasid (access with UT username and password)
2 Highlight or underline 25 new subject-specific words/terms in the article and prepare to explain the vocabulary orally.
3 Prepare to summarise the article orally (5-6 minutes).
4 Upload your article to Moodle at least TWO DAYS prior to individual answering!

grade_preconditions.et:
1 ACTIVE participation in the seminars and/or in the e-study (doing weekly tasks).
2 PASSING weekly self-assessment tests. Weekly self-assessment tests are open on Wednesdays from 18:00- 18:20 (two attempts).
BONUS! The students who attend all the seminars (being well-prepared and active) and pass weekly self-assessment tests at the first attempt with a high score (18-20 points), do not need to take mid-term tests.
3 Passing two mid-term tests with the minimum score of 70%. Both tests can be taken twice.
4 Making a presentation on a subject-specific topic.
5 Reading and summarizing a subject-specific research article.

grade_evaluation.et:
Arvestus saadakse siis, kui SEMESTRI JOOKSUL on täidetud KÕIK hindamisele pääsemise tingimused.
Non-differentiated assessment based on active participation in the seminars and/or in the e-study, passing weekly self-assessment tests, passing two mid-term tests, making a presentation on a subject-specific topic and summarising a subject-specific  research article.

debt_elimination.et:
